intro: Chaetocarpus gabonensis, commonly known as the Gabon haircup, is a flowering plant native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its dense, branched stems covered with fine, hair-like structures. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes, and its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a serrated margin. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and ecologists studying tropical flora.
